titleStmt.title: Fragmenta aulica. Or, Court and state jests in noble drollery True and reall. Ascertained to their times, places and persons. By T. S. Gent.
titleStmt.author: T. S.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for H. Marsh at the Princes Armes in Chancery-lane near Fleetstreet; and Jos. Coniers at the Black-Raven in the long walk near ChristChurch,

notesStmt.note: Includes engraved frontispiece with title: Curia and incuria.
Caption title on p. 10 reads: Court and state jests. Or, Noble drollery.
Running title reads: Court and state drollery.
Includes index and three final pages of advertisement.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Black-Raven in the long walk near ChristChurch
the Princes Armes in Chancery-lane near Fleetstreet;
